Package info.metopt.approx.gradient

Class SteepestDescentMethod

java.lang.Object
info.metopt.approx.AbstractMethod<Vector>
info.metopt.approx.gradient.AbstractGradientMethod
info.metopt.approx.gradient.SteepestDescentMethod
All Implemented Interfaces:
GradientMethod, Method<Vector>
public class SteepestDescentMethod
extends AbstractGradientMethod
Implementation of the GradientMethod interface based on the steepest descent method.

      public SteepestDescentMethod​(Matrix A, Vector b, double c, Vector startX, double epsilon, OneDimensionalMethod oneDimensionalMethod, double maxAlpha, boolean isLog)

    • SteepestDescentMethod

      public SteepestDescentMethod​(Matrix A, Vector b, double c, Vector startX, double epsilon, OneDimensionalMethod oneDimensionalMethod, double maxAlpha, int maxIterationNumber, boolean isLog)
      Constructor with basic values.
      Parameters:
      A - Matrix of coefficients of quadratic form. Element with row index i and column index j is the coefficient of x_i*x_j.
      b - Vector of coefficients of quadratic form. Element with row index i is the coefficient of x_i.
      c - onstant of quadratic form.
      startX - the point Vector from which we start looking for the minimum. The closer the point is to the minimum, the fewer iterations will be needed.
      epsilon - precision value.
      oneDimensionalMethod - OneDimensionalMethod by which the optimal alpha step is calculated
      maxAlpha - maximum alpha step value
      maxIterationNumber - maximum number of iterations.
      isLog - log flag.

    • SteepestDescentMethod
